xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: response:stream-binary
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: response:stream-binary($binary-data as xs:base64Binary, $content-type as xs:string, $filename as xs:string?) as item()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Streams the binary data to the current servlet response output stream. The ContentType HTTP header is set to the value given in $content-type.Note: the servlet output stream will be closed afterwards and mime-type settings in the prolog will not be passed.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $filename? The filename. If no filename is given, then the current request name is used

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: response:stream
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: response:stream($content as item()*, $serialization-options as xs:string) as item()

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Stream can only be used within a servlet context. Itt directly streams its input to the servlet's output stream. It should thus be the last statement in the XQuery.
Returns whether a response object exists.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:boolean : true if the response object exists
